intro: Lagarosolen lui, commonly known as the red hakea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bottle-shaped stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces bright red, urn-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and sandy environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a popular ornamental plant in gardens and conservation areas.
